meta.description: Proposed by Sungyong Chung, Yanlin Zhang, Nachuan Li, Dana Monzer, and Alireza Talebpour, this model introduces a new paradigm of data-driven car-following. It models driving as a Markov process, predicting behavior by randomly sampling accelerations from empirical distributions within discretized state bins.
meta.calibration: Calibration-free. It empirically derives state transitions and acceleration distributions directly from the OpenCF Training Set.
meta.assumptions: Markovian assumption: Future acceleration depends only on the current state cluster defined by relative speed, spacing, and follower speed.

meta.description: Proposed by Sungyong Chung, Yanlin Zhang, Nachuan Li, Dana Monzer, and Alireza Talebpour, this is a safety-enhanced variant of the MC-CF paradigm. It incorporates Time-To-Collision (TTC) thresholds to bias acceleration sampling towards lower percentiles in critical scenarios, ensuring safer trajectory generation.
meta.calibration: Calibration-free. It empirically derives state transitions and acceleration distributions directly from the OpenCF Training Set.
meta.assumptions: Markovian dynamics with probabilistic safety constraints: assumes drivers adopt conservative accelerations (bottom 5-30%) when TTC is below critical thresholds (3s/10s).

meta.calibration: Calibrated using Differential Evolution (scipy.optimize) on the OpenCF Training Set. Objective: Minimize RMSE of Acceleration (a). Parameters calibrated: amaxn (max accel), bn (decel), taun (reaction time), thetan (variability), s0n (min spacing), Vmaxn (max speed), bhat (estimated leader decel).

Calibrated using Differential Evolution (scipy.optimize) on the OpenCF Training Set. Objective: Minimize RMSE of Speed (v). Parameters calibrated: v0 (desired speed), T (time headway), a_max (max accel), b (comfortable decel), s0 (min gap), delta (exponent).
Calibrated using Differential Evolution (scipy.optimize) on the OpenCF Training Set. Objective: Minimize RMSE of Speed (v). Parameters calibrated: v0, T, a_max, b, s0, delta, sigma (noise std dev).
